Class FSM_API.Internal

Provides internal access to the core data structures and operational methods of the FSM API. Members within this class are not intended for direct use by external API consumers.

TickPerformanceWarningThresholdMs

Sets a time limit (in milliseconds) for how long an FSM processing group update can take before a warning message is logged via OnInternalApiError. Helps identify performance bottlenecks. Default is 5ms.

Methods

| Edit this page View Source

DestroyFiniteStateMachine(string, string)

Destroys a complete FSM definition and all of its active instances.

Declaration
public static void DestroyFiniteStateMachine(string fsmDefinitionName, string processingGroup)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string fsmDefinitionName

The unique name of the FSM definition to destroy.
string processingGroup

The name of the processing group where the FSM is registered.
Remarks

This is a critical method for cleaning up the FSM system. It first gracefully shuts down all active instances and then removes the FSM definition itself from the API's internal registry.

It avoids the common "collection modified" error by first creating a temporary list of all instances to be destroyed, and then iterating over that new list.

| Edit this page View Source

DestroyInstance(FSMHandle)

Safely and efficiently destroys a single FSM instance using its handle.

Declaration
public static void DestroyInstance(FSMHandle handle)
Parameters
Type Name Description
FSMHandle handle

The FSMHandle instance to destroy.
Remarks

This method directly indexes into the internal data structures using the FSMHandle's metadata to avoid inefficient and unsafe collection enumeration. It performs the necessary cleanup actions such as invoking the OnExit state logic and clearing error counts.

| Edit this page View Source

GetBucket(string, string)

Retrieves the FSM bucket for a specific FSM definition and processing group.

Declaration
public static FSM_API.Internal.FsmBucket GetBucket(string fsmName, string processGroup)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string fsmName

The name of the FSM definition.
string processGroup

The name of the processing group.
Returns
Type Description
FSM_API.Internal.FsmBucket

The FSM_API.Internal.FsmBucket if found; otherwise, null.
Remarks

This method provides direct access to the internal FSM bucket structure. It includes safety checks to prevent NullReferenceException and KeyNotFoundException if the specified group or FSM name does not exist.

| Edit this page View Source

GetBuckets()

Gets the internal collection of FSM processing buckets.

Declaration
public static Dictionary<string, Dictionary<string, FSM_API.Internal.FsmBucket>> GetBuckets()
Returns
Type Description
Dictionary<string, Dictionary<string, FSM_API.Internal.FsmBucket>>

A nested dictionary representing the core FSM registry.
Remarks

This accessor exposes the central internal data structure of the FSM system. It is intended for advanced internal diagnostics or specific integration scenarios and should be used with caution, respecting the single-threaded update model.

| Edit this page View Source

GetFSMHandle(string, IStateContext, string)

Retrieves a specific FSMHandle for a given FSM definition, context, and processing group.

Declaration
public static FSMHandle GetFSMHandle(string fsmDefinitionName, IStateContext context, string processingGroup)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string fsmDefinitionName

The name of the FSM definition to which the handle belongs.
IStateContext context

The unique context object associated with the FSM instance.
string processingGroup

The processing group the FSM instance is registered under.
Returns
Type Description
FSMHandle

The FSMHandle object if a match is found; otherwise, null.
Remarks

This method provides a way to get a live handle to an FSM instance using its unique context object. It's a useful utility for systems that need to interact directly with a specific FSM instance and its state. The method ensures that all components (processing group, FSM definition, and instance) exist before returning a valid handle.

| Edit this page View Source

ProcessDeferredModifications()

Executes any pending modifications (e.g., adding/removing FSM instances) that were deferred during the FSM update cycle. This ensures collection safety.

Declaration
public static void ProcessDeferredModifications()
Remarks

This method is called internally by Update(string) and should not typically be called directly by users. It guarantees that structural changes to the FSM system (like unregistering instances that hit an error threshold) happen safely after all FSMs for a given tick have completed their processing. Errors during deferred actions are reported via OnInternalApiError.

| Edit this page View Source

ResetAPI(bool)

Resets the internal state of the FSM API.

Declaration
public static void ResetAPI(bool hardReset = false)
Parameters
Type Name Description
bool hardReset

If true, all FSM definitions and instances are completely cleared. If false, all existing FSM instances are unregistered and transitioned to their initial state, and all processing groups are cleared, effectively starting fresh without removing definitions. The deferred modifications queue and error counters are always cleared.
